To count as representing something is to be *responsible* to the represented thing 
 
What is represented provides the normative standard for correctness of representing. 

What is represented has an *authority* over what is representing.

See the [Shopping list](/docs/phil/Shopping list.html) example.

An idea introduced by [Kant](/docs/phil/Immanuel Kant.html) and explicitly developed by [Hegel](/docs/phil/Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel.html). 

Applied by [Rorty](/docs/phil/Richard Rorty.html) to argue for [pragmatism](/docs/phil/Pragmatism.html).
